intro: Hebenstretia polystachya, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and often branched. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands and rocky areas.
